properties.areaDesc: Maury; Williamson; Wayne; Lawrence; Lewis; Marshall; Giles; Bedford
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 5 at 8:22AM CST until February 6 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...Flood Watch for parts of Middle Tennessee this afternoon
through tomorrow morning...

.A slow-moving frontal system will inch its way across Middle
Tennessee over the next 24 hours. This will provide the focus for
widespread showers and few storms, and the rain will be heavy at
times. When added to the rainfall amounts that already fell across
the mid state Tuesday and Tuesday night, there is the potential
for localized flooding through tomorrow morning.

The National Weather Service in Nashville has expanded the

* Flood Watch to include a portion of Middle Tennessee,
including the following areas, Bedford, Giles, Lawrence,
Lewis, Marshall, Maury, Wayne, and Williamson.

* From noon CST today through Thursday morning

* Rainfall will be heavy at times, with and additional 1 to 3
inches falling across the watch area.

* Localized flooding is possible, and fast-rising creeks and
streams may overflow their banks.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING
